message.entry: Invalid value for ''ColumnsBinMethod''.
''ColumnsBinMethod'' is supported only when ''Columns'' is specified.
The number of binning schemes specified by ''ColumnsBinMethod'' must be compatible with the number of variables specified by ''Columns''.
A function handle specified by ''Columns'' must return a logical scalar.
Invalid value for ''Columns''.
All variables specified by ''Columns'' must be vectors.
A function handle specified by ''DataVariable'' must return a logical scalar.
Specify ''DataVariable'' when ''Method'' is specified.
Invalid value for ''DataVariable''.
Unable to apply binning method ''{0}'' to grouping variable ''{1}''.
Unable to apply binning method to grouping variable ''{0}''.
Unable to apply binning method to all grouping variables. Use a cell array or string array to specify a binning method for each grouping variable, with 'none' to indicate no binning.
''IncludedEdge'' is supported only when either ''ColumnsBinMethod'' or ''RowsBinMethod'' is specified.
''IncludeTotals'' value must be false when ''Method'' value is ''none''.
''IncludedEdge'' value must be ''left'' or ''right''.
''Method'' value must be a valid method name or a function handle. Use groupsummary for grouped calculations using multiple methods.
''OutputFormat'' value must be ''nested'' or ''flat''.
''RowLabelPlacement'' value must be ''variable'' or ''rownames''.
Incorrect number of input arguments. Parameter names and values must occur in pairs.
The ''none'' method is supported only when there is at most one value per group.
First input must be a table or timetable.
''DataVariable'' value must specify only one table variable. Use groupsummary for grouped calculations using multiple data variables.

Parameter name must be ''Columns'', ''Rows'', ''DataVariable'', ''Method'', ''ColumnsBinMethod'', ''RowsBinMethod'', ''IncludedEdge'', ''OutputFormat'', ''IncludeTotals'', ''IncludeMissingGroups'', ''IncludeEmptyGroups'', or ''RowLabelPlacement''.
Invalid value for ''RowsBinMethod''.
''RowsBinMethod'' is supported only when ''Rows'' is specified.
The number of binning schemes specified by ''RowsBinMethod'' must be compatible with the number of variables specified by ''Rows''.
A function handle specified by ''Rows'' must return a logical scalar.
Invalid value for ''Rows''.
All variables specified by ''Rows'' must be vectors.
Either ''Rows'' or ''Columns'' must be specified.
